data.title: BIO – www.laurapausini.com
data.text:
Laura Pausini is the most influential and popular female italian singer in the world.

1993 is the year in which Laura Pausini won the Sanremo Festival with “La solitudine”. From that moment onwards, all along her hit-studded career with more than 70 mln albums sold and 226 platinum records, the greatest female Italian singer has never stopped topping international charts.

The acknowledgements received during this memorable career include 1 Grammy Award won in 2006 (first Italian woman ever), 4 Latin Grammy Awards, 6 World Music Awards, 5 ASCAP Awards, 1 Legend Award, 4 IFPI Platinum Awards, 3 Lo Nuestro Awards, 2 Billboard Latin Awards, 1 Platinum Globo, 1 Icon award and recently 1 Golden Globe, 1 Satellite Award, 1 Hollywood Music in Media Award thus resulting the only Italian female singer in history to have received such award, not to forget the nomination at the Emmy and the most recent Oscar nomination for best original song with “Io sì/Seen”.

Her thirteen studio albums and two greatest hits were released worldwide in Italian and Spanish, with songs performed in Italian, Spanish, Portuguese, English and French.

Many world tours which took her to the most prestigious stages in the world: the Circus Maximus in Rome, the Royal Albert Hall in London, the Madison Square Garden and Radio City Music Hall in New York, the Olympia in Paris, she also was the first female artist worldwide to tour in Italian Stadiums.

Laura Pausini has collaborated with top artists such as Madonna, Michael Jackson, Ennio Morricone, Luciano Pavarotti, Phil Collins, Andrea Bocelli, Michael Bublé, Ray Charles, James Blunt, Alejandro Sanz, Luis Fonsi, Gloria Estefan, Marc Anthony, Kylie Minogue and many others.

She also has collaborated with many charitable projects such as Nobel Prize, Live8, Chime for Change, Save the Children, Global Gift Humanitarian Award, Pavarotti and Friends, Amnesty International Control Arms, Unicef, Femmes face au sida, Greenpeace, Goodwill Ambassador for UN World Food Programme, I love Beirut and in 2006 she organized the biggest female concert ever, Amiche per l’Abruzzo, for the people affected by the earthquake in Italy.

She also received a letter from Kofi Annan for contributing to charitable causes recognized by the United Nations.

Pausini is not only a singer, she hosted 3 italian tv shows, the Eurovision Song Contest in 2022, Premio Lo Nuestro in 2018 and she took part in 2 The Voice Mexico, 2 The Voice Spain, 1 xFactor Spain and 2 La Banda as one of the coaches.

In April 2022 she released her first movie “Laura Pausini – Piacere di Conoscerti” (“Un Placer Conocerte” in spanish) on Prime Video in more than 240 territories along with her latest single “Scatola” (“Caja” in spanish), as the original soundtrack.

British “The Sun” has named her among the thirty singers who “will never be forgotten”, the Massachusetts Institute of Technology included her in the “Pantheon” project among the 200 most impactful singers in history, she was also awarded the title of Commander of the Italian Republic by the President of the Italian Republic.

Her voice and her charisma have accompanied us since 1993 and she has been an Icon ever since.

2016

She receives for the fourth time the award Cadena Dial as a recognition for the most successful artists in Spain.

Starting from March 18th, the single "Innamorata is in radio rotation. This single was written for her by Lorenzo Jovanotti Cherubini and several remixes were also made available by the most modern DJ’s and producers.

She debutes on TV as presenter - with her friend Paola Cortellesi – of an extraordinary show entitled "LAURA & PAOLA". Three evening events aired from April 1st in prime time on RAI 1 with big Italian and international guests and broadcast from the historic Studios in Rome.

In June, she stars 4 concert-events in Italian Stadiums: San Siro Stadium in Milan (June 4th and 5th), Olimpico Stadium in Rome (June 11th) and Arena della Vittoria Stadium in Bari (June 18th), followed by a world tour in North and South America and Europe.

The resounding success of the adventure on TV, with her friend Paola Cortellesi, earns the show "Laura & Paola" the Italian Television Award 2016 and Laura, in particular, also the award as Breakthrough TV Host.

On July 14th, she takes part in the ceremony of "Premios Juventud" where she performes with the Mexican singer Mario Domm her song "Víveme" and presents the single "Enamorada" for the first time live.

On August 26th, the single “Ho creduto a me” is released, the fourth single taken from the multi-platinum album “Simili”.

From September she is again one of the judges of "La Banda", season two, this time at her side, as the judges, Wisin and Mario Domm. The program will also be nominated at the International Emmy Awards in the category: Non-English US Primetime Program.

On November 4th, the album "Laura Xmas" is released. This album is entirely dedicated to Christmas songs and also published in Spanish. It is produced by Patrick Williams and recorded with Patrick Williams Orchestra.

She receives a Latin Grammy Awards nomination for the Spanish version of "Lato destro del cuore" in the category "Record Of The Year".

On November 12th, on the occasion of the "Global Gift Gala" in Mexico City, she receives the prestigious "Global Gift Award", for her constant commitment in the field of charity. During the evening she performs a touching acoustic version of "Víveme"; Eva Longoria and Ricky Martin do the honors.

On November 24th, Laura Pausini flies to Disneyland Paris for the world premiere of her album also starring the lighting up of the park Christmas tree and a special happening, reserved for journalists from around the world, in front of the Castle of Sleeping Beauty.

During the premiere of the new album Laura Xmas in Paris, Laura received with great pride a prize that is coveted and desired by all Italian singers honored by the prestigious specialized magazine Sound&Lite: "BEST SHOW 2016".
